pullRequest.title: [no ticket][risk=no] Puppeteer code improvement
pullRequest.bodyText:
Misc improvement:
reorganizing login function:

Remove try...catch block in login function and add try...catch block in enterEmail and enterPassword functions. So that the exact place of failure is more obvious.
Handling of "Enter Recover Email" code in login function is moved to submit function.

New signOut function created in test-utils.
Add new opts: {reset?: boolean} parameter signInAs function to reset page/browser: clear cookies & cached data.
Fix an issue in handleTestEvent function where screenshots skipped when tests fail.
Test suites passed on localhost:

nodes.bodyText: Fail fast in CI. CI will end after 1 test failure.

Address tslint error. == is intentional.
ERROR: 18:29  triple-equals  == should be ===
notebook image updated. Fix broken xpath selector.
Server should be able to handle more concurrent tests. Test playback time is faster.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -6,11 +6,11 @@
   "private": true,
   "license": "BSD",
   "scripts": {
-    "test": "cross-env jest --maxWorkers=3",
+    "test": "cross-env jest --maxWorkers=5",
     "test:debugTest": "cross-env PUPPETEER_HEADLESS=false DEBUG=true node --inspect-brk node_modules/.bin/jest",
     "test:debug": "cross-env PUPPETEER_HEADLESS=false DEBUG=true jest --detectOpenHandles",
-    "test-local": "cross-env WORKBENCH_ENV=local DEBUG=true jest --maxWorkers=2",
-    "test-local:debug": "cross-env WORKBENCH_ENV=local PUPPETEER_HEADLESS=false DEBUG=true jest --maxWorkers=2",
+    "test-local": "cross-env WORKBENCH_ENV=local DEBUG=true jest --maxWorkers=3",
+    "test-local:debug": "cross-env WORKBENCH_ENV=local PUPPETEER_HEADLESS=false DEBUG=true jest --maxWorkers=3",

nodes.bodyText: Replace all non-letter characters with hyphen.

Case test_fn_failure were not working in some cases of failures such as unhandled exceptions, thus no screenshot were taken on failure. Change to case test_done and event.test.errors.length > 0 to cover all types of failures

Should we be doing something here if elementHandle does not exist? It seems like we leave the potential for err to be swallowed by this catch block. That's usually an anti-pattern, but I can't tell from the context whether that's desired behavior here. If it is, it's worth a comment.

What is the impact of this change? It's a surprising enough value I would want to see a comment describing why it's appropriate. Even better if this were in a separate PR, unless it's related to the refactors in other files here.
nit: this comment seems out of place, especially after the refactor. Maybe remove it?

Why is == intentional here? Is getPropValue not returning an actual boolean? If not, I'd expect you could do
wantDisabled == Boolean(await getPropValue<boolean>(downloadBtn, 'disabled'))

== was intentional by CH. Link to that PR comment is here
The simplest way to address the tslint error is to disable the check here.
